content:
🧬 Single-Cell RNA-seq: Decoding Cellular Diversity

What is Single-Cell RNA-seq?

Single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) revolutionizes our understanding of biology by measuring gene expression in individual cells rather than bulk tissue. This technique reveals cellular heterogeneity, developmental trajectories, and rare cell populations that would be hidden in traditional bulk RNA-seq analysis.

🎯 Choose Your Aligner

This pipeline supports four major alignment approaches, each optimized for different experimental needs:

📊 simpleaf (Alevin-fry) - Recommended

  • 🚀 Ultra-fast: Lightning-speed quantification with Alevin-fry
  • 🎯 Protocol flexibility: Define custom chemistries like 1{b[16]u[12]x:}2{r:}
  • 📋 Barcode control: Use trusted whitelists or derive from data
  • ✅ Best for: Most single-cell experiments, especially 10x data

🔬 kallisto|bustools

  • ⚡ Efficient: Pseudoalignment-based quantification
  • 🧬 Protocol support: Pre-defined protocols (10xv3, dropseq) or custom layouts
  • 🎨 Versatile: Excellent for comparative studies
  • ✅ Best for: Research requiring specific protocol customization

⭐ STARsolo

  • 🎯 10x optimized: Native support for 10x protocols (V1-V4)
  • 🧮 Comprehensive: Full alignment with detailed mapping statistics
  • ⚠️ Note: Limited support for non-10x custom protocols
  • ✅ Best for: 10x Genomics datasets requiring full alignment

🏢 cellranger/cellrangermulti/cellrangerarc

  • 🏭 Industry standard: 10x Genomics official pipeline
  • 🔧 Automated: Protocol detection and optimization
  • 📊 Multimodal: Supports feature barcoding and multi-omics
  • ✅ Best for: 10x data requiring official processing

🧪 Protocol Configuration Guide

Understanding Cell Barcodes and Whitelists:

  • 🎯 Trusted Whitelists [WL✓]: Use known, validated barcode sets for reproducibility
  • 🔄 Data-derived [WL✗]: Let the algorithm discover barcodes from your data
  • 📊 Expected Cells: Guide cell calling with approximate cell count estimates

📋 Sample Sheet Configuration

Your CSV samplesheet defines the experiment structure:

sample,fastq_1,fastq_2,expected_cells
control_rep1,control_1_R1.fastq.gz,control_1_R2.fastq.gz,5000
control_rep2,control_2_R1.fastq.gz,control_2_R2.fastq.gz,5000
treated_rep1,treated_1_R1.fastq.gz,treated_1_R2.fastq.gz,4500
treated_rep2,treated_2_R1.fastq.gz,treated_2_R2.fastq.gz,4500

📊 Your Results: Comprehensive Output

Gene Expression Data

  • 📊 Count Matrices: Gene × cell expression matrices in standard formats (H5, MTX)
  • 🏷️ Cell Metadata: Quality metrics, cell type assignments, and filtering statistics
  • 🧬 Feature Data: Gene annotations, mitochondrial content, and expression summaries

Quality Control

  • 📈 MultiQC Report: Comprehensive analysis summary with interactive plots
  • 🔍 Cell-level QC: UMI counts, gene detection, mitochondrial percentages
  • 📊 Sample Comparisons: Batch effects, sequencing depth, and technical metrics

Analysis-Ready Outputs

  • 🧮 Seurat Objects: Ready for downstream analysis in R
  • 🐍 AnnData Files: Compatible with scanpy and Python ecosystems
  • 📊 Visualization Files: UMAP/t-SNE coordinates and cluster assignments

Perfect for Research in: Developmental biology • Cancer research • Immunology • Neuroscience • Plant biology • Stem cell research • Drug discovery • Tissue engineering
